question: Why is the annual renewal of Alliance user accounts necessary?
answer: Annual renewal is essential to collect up-to-date information required by granting agencies and to deactivate accounts that are no longer in use.

question: By when must all Alliance users renew their accounts?
answer: All Alliance users must renew their account by June 10, 2025.

question: What happens if I don't renew my Alliance account by the deadline?
answer: Your account will be automatically deactivated after June 10, 2025. You will not be able to access your data, but it will not be deleted immediately.

question: Can a deactivated Alliance account be renewed?
answer: Yes, you can renew your account at any time after it has been deactivated.

question: Do I need to renew my Alliance account if I created it recently?
answer: If you created your account after January 1, 2025, you do not have to renew it at this time. However, you still need to accept new policies and consents, which will prompt on CCDB upon your first login.

question: Where can I view the Privacy Policy and other agreements I have accepted?
answer: All agreements you are required to accept or indicate your preference for must be accepted on CCDB. Once signed, you can see them on the CCDB page.

question: What types of agreements might I need to accept on CCDB?
answer: This includes Policies, Standards, Terms, and Procedures; Consent to Access User Data; Optional transfer of file ownership on account deactivation; and Consent to receive optional news and communications from the Digital Research Alliance of Canada.

question: Where can I find the Alliance policies online?
answer: The policies are available on the Alliance website at https://alliancecan.ca/en/policies.

question: What is considered a primary role for an Alliance account?
answer: Your primary role should correspond to your main position, generally the one you will hold for the longest. For example, a full-time faculty appointment or the role with your primary supervisor if you are a student or researcher.

question: What is the consequence of not renewing my primary role?
answer: If you do not renew your primary role during the annual renewal period, your account will be deactivated.

question: Why are primary roles important for Alliance accounts?
answer: Primary roles help manage accounts with multiple roles, facilitate communication with users, and assist with reporting.

question: Can I change my primary role on CCDB?
answer: Yes, users with multiple active roles can change their primary role at any time on CCDB's 'Home' page.

question: How do I change my primary role on CCDB?
answer: On CCDB's 'Home' page, go to the role of your choosing and click on the 'Make this role primary' checkbox located next to it.

question: What should I do if my academic or employment situation has changed?
answer: If your role has changed, you must apply for a new role. You can do this by logging into CCDB and navigating to 'My Account' → 'Apply for a new role'.

question: If I need several roles due to a change in my situation, how should I apply for them?
answer: Please request one role at a time. Any new role approved is set as your primary role by default, but you can uncheck the 'Make this role primary?' box if you don't wish it to be.

question: How can I disable old roles after applying for a new one?
answer: If your current role(s) is no longer needed, click on “disable old roles.” This will leave your new role as the primary one and deactivate any other role you have.

question: Who should I contact if I need technical support for the Canadian Common CV (CCV) website, such as a forgotten username or password?
answer: You should contact the CCV helpdesk directly by email (support@cihr-irsc.gc.ca) or by phone (613-954-1968 or 1-888-603-4178).

question: Who do I contact for questions about the Alliance CCV template or issues submitting my CCV on the CCDB?
answer: You should contact support@tech.alliancecan.ca by email.

question: Does the Alliance Federation provide CCV support for all users?
answer: The Alliance Federation provides support ONLY for users that need to submit a CCV to renew an Alliance account or apply for RAC. Non-Alliance users should contact the agency to which they are trying to submit a CCV.

question: My Alliance account is deactivated, but I need to access my data to move it off the clusters. What should I do?
answer: Please send an email to support@tech.alliancecan.ca so that they can assist you with your request.

question: If my account renewal question isn't in this FAQ, who can I contact for help?
answer: Please send an email to renewals@tech.alliancecan.ca for assistance.
